meanings.definition: Tending to flit or flutter around quickly and lightly.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly was the flightiest creature in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The hummingbird is known as one of the flightiest birds due to its rapid movements.
meanings.sent3: The flightiest squirrel in the park kept darting from tree to tree, never staying still.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like the flightiest of butterflies, never settling on one idea for long.
meanings.sent5: The wind carried the flightiest petals of the dandelion across the field.

meanings.definition: Easily distracted or prone to changing one's mind quickly.
meanings.sent1: She was the flightiest student in the class, always switching topics in the middle of a conversation.
meanings.sent2: The flightiest puppy couldn't decide which toy to play with and kept jumping from one to another.
meanings.sent3: His flightiest behavior at work led to him forgetting important tasks and deadlines.
meanings.sent4: Her flightiest nature made it challenging for her to commit to long-term plans.
meanings.sent5: The flightiest clouds in the sky seemed to change shape every few seconds.
